resources.string: Query the vehicle\'s ECU on the supported OBD commands
The time delta between two measurements in seconds (current value: %s). Note: the lower the value, the bigger the data volume. Only consider changing if you are aware of the consequences.
Automatic Upload of Tracks (in WiFi only)
Enables the automatic upload of all recorded tracks when connecting to the wireless network.
When checked, this setting keeps the screen on when the application is running.
Use imperial units (miles) for displaying values
Only upload measurements which are taken 250 meter (820 feet) and one minute after start and before end of each track
Enabling the verbal announcements of specific events, e.g. OBD-connection established/lost, track finished.
Manage the pairings to Bluetooth devices.

Automatically connects to the OBDII adapter and starts the recording of a track. This feature periodically checks whether the selected OBDII adapter is in range. Therefore, this setting requires additional battery power.
Automatically starts the background service whenever Bluetooth gets activated.
The search interval at which the device searches for the selected OBDII device. Note: the higher the value, the more battery gets drained.
